Source code for GPy.kern._src.prod

# Copyright (c) 2012, GPy authors (see AUTHORS.txt).
# Licensed under the BSD 3-clause license (see LICENSE.txt)

import numpy as np
from kern import CombinationKernel
from ...util.caching import Cache_this
import itertools


[docs]class Prod(CombinationKernel):
    """
    Computes the product of 2 kernels

    :param k1, k2: the kernels to multiply
    :type k1, k2: Kern
    :param tensor: The kernels are either multiply as functions defined on the same input space (default) or on the product of the input spaces
    :type tensor: Boolean
    :rtype: kernel object

    """
    def __init__(self, kernels, name='mul'):
        for i, kern in enumerate(kernels[:]):
            if isinstance(kern, Prod):
                del kernels[i]
                for part in kern.parts[::-1]:
                    kern.unlink_parameter(part)
                    kernels.insert(i, part)
        super(Prod, self).__init__(kernels, name)

    @Cache_this(limit=2, force_kwargs=['which_parts'])

[docs]    def K(self, X, X2=None, which_parts=None):
        if which_parts is None:
            which_parts = self.parts
        elif not isinstance(which_parts, (list, tuple)):
            # if only one part is given
            which_parts = [which_parts]
        return reduce(np.multiply, (p.K(X, X2) for p in which_parts))


    @Cache_this(limit=2, force_kwargs=['which_parts'])

[docs]    def Kdiag(self, X, which_parts=None):
        if which_parts is None:
            which_parts = self.parts
        return reduce(np.multiply, (p.Kdiag(X) for p in which_parts))



[docs]    def update_gradients_full(self, dL_dK, X, X2=None):
        k = self.K(X,X2)*dL_dK
        for p in self.parts:
            p.update_gradients_full(k/p.K(X,X2),X,X2)



[docs]    def update_gradients_diag(self, dL_dKdiag, X):
        k = self.Kdiag(X)*dL_dKdiag
        for p in self.parts:
            p.update_gradients_diag(k/p.Kdiag(X),X)



[docs]    def gradients_X(self, dL_dK, X, X2=None):
        target = np.zeros(X.shape)
        k = self.K(X,X2)*dL_dK
        for p in self.parts:
            target += p.gradients_X(k/p.K(X,X2),X,X2)
        return target



[docs]    def gradients_X_diag(self, dL_dKdiag, X):
        target = np.zeros(X.shape)
        k = self.Kdiag(X)*dL_dKdiag
        for p in self.parts:
            target += p.gradients_X_diag(k/p.Kdiag(X),X)
        return target
